BillTitle: taxes.  Providing that an income tax on earned personal income shall be prohibited.
taxes.  Providing that any broad-based sales tax shall be prohibited.
use of money raised by taxation for education.  Providing that money raised by taxation may be applied for the use of religious educational institutions.
use of money raised by taxation for education.  Providing that money raised by taxation may be applied for the use of religious educational institutions.
redistricting.  Providing that an independent redistricting commission shall be established to draw boundaries for state and federal offices.
New Hampshire general court.  Providing that the provision for compensation of legislators is removed.
relative to the rates of business profits tax and the business enterprise tax.
BillAnalysis: This bill reduces the rates of the business profits tax and the business enterprise tax.

BillTitle: raising the minimum age of marriage.
BillAnalysis: This bill raises the minimum age of marriage from 16 to 18 years of age.

BillTitle: relative to absentee voting and allowing for partial processing of absentee ballots prior to election day.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows no-excuse absentee voting and partial processing of absentee ballots prior to election day.

BillTitle: relative to continued in-network access to certain health care providers.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires access by a covered person to a provider in the insurer's provider directory at in-network rates for the duration of the contract for health care services.

BillTitle: relative to the reversal or forgiveness of emergency order violations.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that the state shall not enforce, and shall reverse, any prior finding of violation of the governor's emergency orders regarding the COVID-19 pandemic.  The bill also provides for annulment of an arrest or criminal conviction for violation of an emergency order issued in response to COVID-19.

BillTitle: relative to renewable generation facility property subject to a voluntary payment in lieu of taxes agreement.
BillAnalysis: This bill clarifies the exclusion of  a renewable generation facility's payments in lieu of taxes from a municipality's tax base for the education tax.

BillTitle: requiring food service establishments to establish food allergy awareness procedures.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires food service establishments to establish food allergy awareness procedures.

BillTitle: relative to the use of deadly force by a law enforcement officer.
BillAnalysis: This bill removes the legal authority for a law enforcement officer to use deadly force in effecting an arrest.

BillTitle: relative to warrant articles in official ballot town, school district, or village district meetings.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that original warrant articles be placed on the official ballot at certain meetings even if such articles have been amended during the first session of the meeting.

BillTitle: relative to the definition of child abuse.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds sexual reassignment to the definition of an abused child in RSA 169-C, the child protection act.

BillTitle: relative to the display of the national motto in schools.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits school boards to provide copies of the national motto of the United States for display in each school building in the district.

BillTitle: authorizing certification for the microblading of eyebrows.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows certain persons who are not licensed for tattooing as body art practitioners to perform microblading of eyebrows.

BillTitle: relative to school district emergency special meetings.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the superior court from allowing special school meetings for specified reasons.

BillTitle: relative to ratification of amendments to the state building code and state fire code.
BillAnalysis: This bill ratifies certain amendments to the state building code and state fire code adopted by the fire marshal and state building code review board in 2015, 2016, 2019, and 2020.

BillTitle: relative to public notice requirements for certain permits issued by the department of environmental services.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires public notice using electronic means for certain permits issued by the department of environmental services.

BillTitle: relative to the Merrimack ramp toll plazas.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the commissioner of the department of transportation from adding ramp toll plazas or open road tolls in the town of Merrimack unless tolls are placed in other locations on the F.E. Everett Turnpike that have more traffic.

BillTitle: renaming and adjusting the membership of the New Hampshire commission on deafness and hearing loss.
BillAnalysis: This bill changes the name of the New Hampshire commission on deafness and hearing loss to the New Hampshire commission for the deaf and hard of hearing and adds members to the commission.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: prohibiting paper billing fees.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits a person from charging an additional fee for paying by mail or receiving a paper billing statement.

BillTitle: requiring town and city clerks to provide daily notification to the secretary of state of any filings for elected office.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that town and city clerks provide a daily update of candidates who have filed for nomination to the secretary of state.

BillTitle: relative to certificates of title and drivers' licenses for members of the United States foreign service.
BillAnalysis: This bill clarifies the circumstances under which certain New Hampshire residents in the United States foreign service may apply for or renew certificates of title and drivers' licenses.

BillTitle: relative to town health officers.
relative to expenditures from the energy efficiency fund.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the public utilities commission to include school districts in the allocation of energy efficiency funds, increases the statewide allocation for energy efficiency programs, and requires rebates from the use of auction proceeds to all commercial and industrial retail energy ratepayers.

BillTitle: relative to the justified use of deadly force upon another person.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits the use of deadly force in defense of another person.

BillTitle: relative to amending a conservation easement between the state and a landowner.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows the amendment of a conservation easement between a governmental body and a landowner.

BillTitle: prohibiting non-disparagement clauses in settlement agreements involving a governmental unit.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits and renders unenforceable the inclusion of a non-disparagement clause in a settlement agreement involving a governmental unit.

BillTitle: declaring May 21 as Ona "Oney" Judge Day and naming the new terminal at Portsmouth international airport at Pease in her honor.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes May 21 as Ona "Oney" Judge Day and names the new airport terminal at the Portsmouth international airport at Pease in her honor.

BillTitle: relative to using Atlantic Standard Time in New Hampshire.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that New Hampshire will use Atlantic Standard Time throughout the calendar year if Massachusetts and Maine also move to Atlantic Standard Time.

BillTitle: relative to the definition of electioneering.
BillAnalysis: This bill amends the definition of "electioneering" to remove the prohibition against wearing clothing or paraphernalia that a reasonable person would believe explicitly advocates for or against any candidate, political party, or measure being voted.

BillTitle: relative to the city of Claremont police commission.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that the city council of Claremont shall appoint the police commission.

BillTitle: adding qualifying medical conditions to the therapeutic use of cannabis law.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds moderate to severe insomnia to the definition of "qualifying medical condition" for the purposes of the use of cannabis for therapeutic purposes law.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: allowing alternative treatment centers to acquire and use in manufacturing hemp-derived cannabidiol (CBD) isolate.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows alternative treatment centers to acquire and use in manufacturing hemp-derived cannabidiol (CBD) isolate.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: allowing alternative treatment centers to acquire and use in manufacturing hemp-derived cannabidiol (CBD) isolate.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows alternative treatment centers to acquire and use in manufacturing hemp-derived cannabidiol (CBD) isolate.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: relative to death benefits of first responders who die from suicide.
BillAnalysis: This bill includes suicide under the definition of "killed in the line of duty" when considering eligibility for death benefits of first responders.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study best practices for companion animal groomers.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study best practices for companion animal groomers.

BillTitle: relative to human trafficking and child exploitation prevention.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the manufacture, sale, or lease of an internet-enabled device unless the device includes a filter that blocks obscene material and establishes a fee for deactivating the filter.  The bill also establishes a live adult entertainment admission fee.  Both fees would be deposited in a human trafficking and child exploitation prevention grant fund, to be administered by the attorney general.

BillTitle: relative to licensure renewal dates for certain governing boards under the office of professional licensure and certification.
BillAnalysis: This bill revises the procedure and timeframe for license renewals of allied health professionals, body art practitioners, podiatrists, chiropractors, acupuncturists, and veterinarians.

BillTitle: relative to milk pasteurization.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows for the sale of products made with raw milk in certain circumstances.

BillTitle: establishing the office of school counseling and psychology, establishing the position of school counselor coordinator, and making an appropriation therefor.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes the office of school counseling and psychology in the division of learner support, department of education.  This bill also establishes the position of school counselor coordinator in the office of school counseling and psychology and makes an appropriation therefor.

BillTitle: modifying the dates of the state primary and associated filing deadline.
BillAnalysis: This bill changes the date of the state primary election to the second Tuesday in August.

BillTitle: relative to the date of the state primary election.
BillAnalysis: This bill changes the date of the state primary election to the first Tuesday in June.

BillTitle: relative to seasonal platforms on public waters of the state.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that any person seeking to anchor a floating dock, seasonal platform, inflatable platform or float on public waters of the state adhere to requirements specified by the department of safety, division of marine patrol.

BillTitle: relative to the close of a county's books of records.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires counties to close their books 30 days following the end of the fiscal year unless  granted an extension by the commissioner of revenue administration.

BillTitle: relative to worldwide combined reporting for unitary businesses under the business profits tax.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals the water's edge combined group provisions of the business profits tax.

BillTitle: establishing a dental benefit under the state Medicaid program.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the commissioner of the department of health and human services to solicit information and to contract with dental managed care organizations to provide dental care to persons under the Medicaid managed care program.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study the feasibility of personal rapid transit systems and unconventional public transit methods.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study whether personal rapid transit systems and unconventional public transit methods are feasible.

BillTitle: relative to political contributions made by limited liability companies.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that a political contribution by a limited liability company be allocated to members for purposes of determining whether a member has exceeded the contribution limits.

BillTitle: establishing procedures for municipal host customer-generators of electrical energy.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes an exemption under net energy metering for group net metered facilities that generate electricity to offset electrical requirements of a group consisting of political subdivisions.

BillTitle: relative to the minimum hourly rate.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes the state minimum hourly rate at $22.50 per hour.

BillTitle: relative to minutes and decisions in nonpublic sessions under the right-to-know law.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that for meetings in nonpublic session where the minutes or decisions were determined to not be subject to public disclosure, a list shall be kept which shall include certain information.  The list shall be made available for public disclosure.

BillTitle: relative to the referral of debts for collection.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires creditors to give affirmative notice to a consumer before bills for goods or services may be referred for collection.

BillTitle: relative to the distribution of adequate education grants.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the department of education to distribute adequate education grants to municipalities and requires such municipalities to transfer the grants to their school district or districts.

BillTitle: establishing a cause of action against the state to protect individual rights.
BillAnalysis: This bill creates a cause of action in state court for an injury to an individual caused by an agent of the state of New Hampshire, or any of its political subdivisions, which constitutes the violation of a right under state or federal law.

BillTitle: relative to payment for earned but unused vacation or personal time.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires an employer to pay an employee for earned but unused vacation time.

BillTitle: relative to the erection of a sound barrier in the vicinity of Teaberry Lane in the town of Bedford.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the department of transportation to erect a sound barrier on the F.E. Everett Turnpike in the town of Bedford.

BillTitle: relative to wake surfing.
BillAnalysis: This bill defines and regulates "wake surfing."

BillTitle: relative to personal delivery devices and mobile carriers.
BillAnalysis: This bill defines and regulates personal delivery devices and mobile carriers.

BillTitle: relative to the use of force at New Hampshire national guard facilities.
BillAnalysis: This bill specifies circumstances for the use of force at New Hampshire national guard facilities.

BillTitle: relative to the fish and game commission.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes changes to the fish and game commission including notice of appointment, qualifications, and misconduct and removal from office.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseFish and Game and Marine Resources

BillTitle: relative to legislative approval of the New Hampshire general court for increases in the systems benefit charge.
BillAnalysis: This bill removes the requirement for legislative approval of changes to the system benefits charge to electric consumers.

BillTitle: relative to administration of psychotropic medications to children in foster care.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the department of health and human services to provide medication monitoring for children in foster care and to ensure that the use of medication restraint conforms with the limitations of RSA 126-U.

BillTitle: establishing an independent redistricting commission.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes an independent redistricting commission.

BillTitle: making an appropriation to the Carroll and  Strafford counties freight rail improvements project and making an appropriation for the Coos county freight rail improvement  project.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes a capital appropriation of $2,000,000 to the department of transportation for the Carroll and Strafford freight rail improvements project.  The appropriation is contingent upon the receipt of matching private funds.

BillTitle: granting immunity from prosecution for prostitution for reporting a sexual assault.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides immunity from prosecution for prostitution for a person reporting to law enforcement that such person or another person is the victim of a sexual assault.

BillTitle: adopting the uniform real property transfer on death act.
BillAnalysis: This bill adopts the uniform real property transfer on death act.  The act provides a  mechanism for the nonprobate transfer of land, done by permitting owners of interests in real property to execute and record a transfer on death (TOD) deed.

BillTitle: relative to post-arrest photo distribution by law enforcement officers.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits law enforcement from distributing post-arrest photos of suspects except in certain circumstances.

BillTitle: relative to notice of execution of tax lien to mortgagees.
BillAnalysis: This bill extends the time for the notice of the execution of a municipal or state tax lien to be given to a mortgagee.

BillTitle: relative to placement and removal of political advertising.
BillAnalysis: This bill clarifies the circumstances under which political advertisements may be placed on public property.

BillTitle: adding notification requirements to the weather modification statute.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires notice before a state agency attempts to modify the weather.

BillTitle: prohibiting the installation or use  of electronic tracking software.
relative to administration by the retirement system of certain health care premium deductions.
BillAnalysis: This bill clarifies the deduction by the retirement system of a member's or beneficiary's health care premium costs as determined by the department of administrative services.

BillTitle: relative to reporting of health care associated infections.
BillAnalysis: This bill clarifies the information that hospitals must report regarding infections.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: relative to acreage required to build certain single family housing.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits zoning ordinances from requiring certain acreage for certain single family housing units.

BillTitle: creating a cause of action for censorship by social media websites.
BillAnalysis: This bill creates a private right of action by a social media website user in this state against a social media website.

BillTitle: creating a cause of action for censorship by social media websites.
BillAnalysis: This bill creates a private right of action by a social media website user in this state against a social media website.

BillTitle: repealing certain inactive dedicated funds.
BillAnalysis: This bill deletes certain inactive dedicated funds and adds others to the list of dedicated funds in RSA 6:12.  The bill also changes the reporting year for the office of professional licensure and certification.

BillTitle: requiring parties responsible for pollution of a drinking water supply to be financially responsible for certain consequences of that pollution.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires parties deemed responsible for pollution of a drinking water supply to be financially responsible for certain consequences of that pollution.

BillTitle: requiring schools to update documents and software to include the option of identifying a student as non-binary.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires schools to update documents and software to include the option of identifying a student as non-binary.

BillTitle: relative to the rulemaking authority of the department of information technology.
BillAnalysis: This bill exempts certain statewide standards and protocols relative to information technology, networks, telephony, and cyber security developed by the department of information technology from rulemaking under RSA 541-A.

BillTitle: allowing prisoners serving life sentences to be eligible for parole after 25 years.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires parole review of certain offenders sentenced to life without parole.

BillTitle: relative to the submission of evidence in divorce proceedings.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits the parties to request a continuance if evidence in a divorce proceeding is not submitted prior to the hearing.

BillTitle: relative to private rights of action regarding pupil safety.
BillAnalysis: This bill creates a private right of action for bullying and cyberbullying.

BillTitle: relative to causes for divorce.
BillAnalysis: This bill revises the fault-based grounds for divorce.

BillTitle: relative to an electronic prescription drug program.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires electronic prescribing for controlled drugs under certain circumstances.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: relative to an electronic prescription drug program.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires electronic prescribing for controlled drugs under certain circumstances.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: relative to an electronic prescription drug program.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires electronic prescribing for controlled drugs under certain circumstances.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: relative to an electronic prescription drug program.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires electronic prescribing for controlled drugs under certain circumstances.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: relative to absentee ballot request forms.
BillAnalysis: This bill modifies the absentee ballot request forms and absentee ballot envelopes.

BillTitle: relative to physical force in defense of a person.
BillAnalysis: This bill removes certain instances where using deadly force to defend oneself or another person is not legally justifiable.

BillTitle: requiring health care providers to furnish upon request a list of ingredients contained in an injectable medication that is recommended or administered.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires health care providers to furnish upon request a list of ingredients contained in any injectable medication that is recommended or administered.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: relative to assault against an elderly person.
BillAnalysis: This bill creates a first degree assault offense for an assault against a person 65 years of age or older by a person who is more than 10 years of age older than the victim.

BillTitle: allowing increased net energy metering limits for municipal hydroelectric facilities.
BillAnalysis: This bill increases the electric generating capacity of municipal hydroelectric facilities who may participate in net energy metering to 5 megawatts.

BillTitle: extending certain civil immunity to public and private entities during major public health emergencies.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes immunity from civil liability for public and private entities during a declared state of emergency due to a public health risk if the entity was acting in good faith and in accordance with public health and safety directives.

BillTitle: making a technical correction and a clarification in the law governing death benefits for emergency medical technicians and rescue squad members.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes a technical correction in the law governing death benefits for emergency medical technicians and rescue squad members.  This bill also clarifies the definition of "rescue squad member."

BillTitle: relative to changes of registration of certain voters after a primary election.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that the registration of undeclared voters who register as members of a party at any primary shall be returned to undeclared registrations by the supervisors of the checklist after the close of the polls on election day.

BillTitle: relative to the apportionment of costs in cooperative school districts.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits the apportionment formula for a cooperative school district to be subject to review 5 years after an article to continue the current formula was passed.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study universal Internet access for New Hampshire.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study universal Internet access for New Hampshire.

BillTitle: relative to community revitalization tax relief incentives.
BillAnalysis: This bill enables municipalities to offer community revitalization tax incentives for the construction of additional housing in designated areas.  The bill also revises the criteria for assistance from the affordable housing fund administered by the housing finance authority.

BillTitle: renaming Columbus Day as Indigenous People's Day.
BillAnalysis: This bill renames Columbus Day as Indigenous People's Day for the purpose of state holidays.

BillTitle: relative to posting legislative amendments on the New Hampshire legislative website.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the general court to post amendments on the general court website after they are made public or presented to a legislative committee by a member.

BillTitle: repealing the state health assessment and state health improvement plan council.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals the state health improvement plan and the state health improvement plan advisory council.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: relative to the definition of prime wetland.
BillAnalysis: This bill further defines prime wetland for local protection in fill and dredge permits.

BillTitle: relative to organizations authorized to issue decals for multi-use decal number plates.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits the New Hampshire State Council of the Knights of Columbus to issue decals for multi-use plates.

BillTitle: relative to notice of rent increases in certain residential rental property.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires notice by a landlord of at least 60 days of a proposed rent increase which exceeds 5 percent or notice of at least 90 days of an increase which exceeds 8 percent.

BillTitle: relative to the calculation of child support.
BillAnalysis: This bill revises the child support guideline percentages, increases the self-support reserve amount, defines a shared parenting plan, and establishes a new formula for the calculation of child support in cases involving shared parenting plans.

BillTitle: permitting tastings by liquor manufacturers at farmers' markets.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows liquor manufacturers to offer samples at farmers' markets.

BillTitle: relative to cannabis use during pregnancy.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires alternative treatment centers to prepare information regarding the risk of cannabis use during pregnancy.  The bill also requires the commissioner of the department of health and human services to prepare a brochure relative to the risk of cannabis use during pregnancy and while breastfeeding.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: relative to the acquisition, sale, or demolition of municipal land or buildings.
relative to noncompete agreements for certain mental health professionals.
BillAnalysis: This bill mandates that certain noncompete provisions in employment contracts for pastoral psychotherapists, clinical social workers, clinical mental health counselors, and marriage and family therapists licensed by the board of mental health practice and psychologists licensed by the board of psychologists, are not enforceable.

BillTitle: relative to safety requirements for pools on foreclosed residential property.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that any pool, spa, or other water feature structure on the premises of a foreclosed residential property have an approved cover or net.

BillTitle: relative to net energy metering limits for customer generators and the purchase of output of limited electrical energy producers.
BillAnalysis: This bill increases the electric generating capacity of customer generators who may participate in net energy metering and modifies the transition of tariffs applicable to certain customer-generators.  The bill clarifies the definition of eligible customer-generator for purposes of the utility property tax.  The bill also expands the authority of limited producers of electrical energy to sell its output in the private sector.

BillTitle: requiring the adoption of innovative vehicle emissions standards pursuant to section 177 of the federal Clean Air Act.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the adoption of California Low Emission/Zero Emission vehicle standards to protect public health, enable New Hampshire automotive customers to utilize the extended emissions-specific warranty, and to enable New Hampshire automotive dealers to carry Zero Emissions Vehicles in stock.  The bill also makes an appropriation to the department of environmental services to fund an additional position.

BillTitle: establishing a commission to study the removal of unused utility poles following the transition of equipment, lines, and cables to new utility poles.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a commission to study the removal of unused utility poles following the transition of equipment, lines, and cables to new utility poles.

BillTitle: commemorating the first labor strike in the United States by women.
BillAnalysis: This bill proclaims a yearly commemoration of the first labor strike in the United States by women in Dover.

BillTitle: relative to food in cigar shops.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows the service but not the sale of food in cigar shops holding an on-premises cigar, beverage, and liquor license.

BillTitle: establishing greenhouse gas emission reduction goals for the state and establishing a climate action plan.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes greenhouse gas emission reduction goals for the state and authorizes the department of environmental services to inventory greenhouse gas emissions on an annual basis and to develop and report on a 5-year action plan.

BillTitle: requiring the independent investment committee of the New Hampshire retirement system to report investment fees.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the quarterly report of the retirement system's independent investment committee to include a description of investment fees.  The bill also requires independent investment committee reports to be available on the retirement system's Internet website.

BillTitle: relative to reporting a collision between a cat and a motor vehicle.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the reporting of a collision between a cat and a motor vehicle to the cat's owner or the police.

BillTitle: relative to reciprocal driver education.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the commissioner of the department of safety to issue a driver's license to any individual who can provide satisfactory evidence of completion of a course of driver education approved by the state in which the course was offered.

BillTitle: allowing beverages, wine, and mixed drinks to be sold for take out and delivery by restaurants holding an on-premises license.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows beverages, wine, and mixed drinks to be sold for take out and delivery by restaurants holding an on-premises license.

BillTitle: prohibiting the siting of a landfill near a state park.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the siting of new landfills, excluding expansions of existing landfills, near state parks.  This bill also defines state parks for the purposes of prohibiting the siting of new landfills.

BillTitle: relative to the parole of prisoners and the procedures of the adult parole board.
BillAnalysis: This bill amends various provisions of the adult parole process including the definition of violent crime and recommittal of prisoners who violate parole.

BillTitle: relative to enhanced penalties based on prior convictions for driving under the influence of drugs or liquor.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes an enhanced penalty for persons convicted of negligent homicide who have prior convictions for driving under the influence of drugs or liquor.

BillTitle: increasing the penalty for buyers under the law regarding trafficking in persons.
BillAnalysis: This bill changes the penalty for a person who pays to engage in sexual contact with another person under the age of 18 who is a victim of human trafficking.

BillTitle: relative to the local option for operation of sports book retail locations.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows a vote for accepting operation of sports book retail locations by a city at the state primary election.

BillTitle: relative to approval of coursework completed at other approved schools
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the principal or other administrator of a high school to grant credit for courses and programs completed at other approved schools.

BillTitle: prohibiting municipalities from requiring a license for a lemonade stand operated by a person under the age of 18.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits a city, town, or village district from licensing or regulating a lemonade stand operated by a person under the age of 18.

BillTitle: relative to the operation of personal water craft around the marshlands or flats of the Rye estuary and the New Castle back channel.
BillAnalysis: This bill prohibits the operation of personal water craft within 300 feet of any marsh land or flat of the Rye estuary and the New Castle back channel.

BillTitle: removing the work requirement of the New Hampshire granite advantage health care program.
BillAnalysis: This bill removes the work and community engagement requirements of the New Hampshire granite advantage health care program.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: repealing certain inactive committees and revising the membership or duties of certain committees, councils, and boards.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals certain inactive committees and revises the membership and duties of others.

BillTitle: relative to the emergency powers of the commissioner of health and human services.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes various changes to the powers of the commissioner of the department of health and human services during a public health emergency; authorizes the joint legislative oversight committee on health and human services to review, and rescind by a 2/3 vote, emergency orders issued by the commissioner; gives a person subject to a treatment order for a communicable disease a right to a hearing on the order; and amends the membership and duties of the ethics oversight advisory committee.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: relative to appointment of counsel in juvenile court proceedings.
BillAnalysis: This bill directs the court to appoint counsel for a minor when the juvenile delinquency petition is filed or the summons issued.  The bill also provides that a confession or statement from an unrepresented minor shall not be used in any judicial proceeding.

BillTitle: relative to accessory dwelling units.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows as a right the addition of up to 3 accessory dwelling units on a single-family dwelling.

BillTitle: relative to financial disclosures by legislators.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that the legislative ethics financial disclosure form for members and officers of the general court shall only be filed in January of the first year of the biennium.

BillTitle: relative to prior authorizations and patient transfers under managed care group health insurance policies.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds requirements for prior authorizations under managed care health benefit plans and the administration of patient transfers to another health care facility.

BillTitle: relative to pistols permitted for the taking of deer.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds additional pistols permitted for the taking of deer.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseFish and Game and Marine Resources

BillTitle: relative to penalties for improper timber harvesting.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that any person who negligently or recklessly causes timber to be cut on the land of another shall be guilty of trespass under RSA 227-J, relative to timber harvesting.

BillTitle: relative to the release of student assessment information and data.
BillAnalysis: This bill:

BillTitle: adding display of a firearm as an exception to reckless conduct.
BillAnalysis: This bill inserts an exception to the crime of reckless conduct for the display of a firearm.

BillTitle: adding trespass as an exception to the charge of criminal threatening.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds an exception to the criminal threatening statute for a person who displays a firearm to warn away a trespasser.

BillTitle: relative to the use of deadly force in defense of another.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits the use of deadly force against another person in circumstance where deadly force is used in the commission of felony against a person in a vehicle or in the commission of riot against a person within such person's vehicle, dwelling or its curtilege.

BillTitle: relative to an exception to the opportunity for public education without discrimination.
BillAnalysis: This bill excepts biological males by birth from the provision that no person may be excluded from participation in public schools as that provision applies to participation in all-female athletics.

BillTitle: including soil health and soil conservation in the state soil conservation plan.
BillAnalysis: This bill amends current provisions relative to soil conservation to include soil health and climate and environmental change mitigation and adaptation.

BillTitle: increasing the penalty for certain invasions of privacy.
BillAnalysis: This bill increases the criminal penalty for certain violations of privacy and nonconsensual dissemination of private sexual images.

BillTitle: relative to review by the insurance department of coverage for pediatric autoimmune neuropsychiatric disorders.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires the commissioner of insurance to review the implementation of the requirement for coverage of pediatric autoimmune neuropsychiatric disorders as adopted by 2019, 277 (SB 244-FN) and to report to the legislature.

BillTitle: relative to school lunch payment policies.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires school boards that provide free or reduced cost meals to refrain from certain actions that could stigmatize a child who requests such a meal.

BillTitle: establishing a committee to study school meal programs in New Hampshire's public schools and non-sectarian schools that accept public funds.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes a committee to study school meal programs in New Hampshire's public schools and nonsectarian schools that accept public funds.

BillTitle: proclaiming January 24 as "Granny D" day.
BillAnalysis: This bill proclaims January 24 as Granny D. Day.

BillTitle: relative to incarceration under a suspended sentence.
BillAnalysis: This bill amends the amount of time that must be served by a person incarcerated under a suspended sentence before petitioning for the suspension of the remainder of the sentence.

BillTitle: relative to collective bargaining agreement strategy discussions under the right-to-know law.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires that collective bargaining agreement strategy discussions where only one party is present shall not constitute a meeting open to the public under the right-to-know law.

BillTitle: repealing the regulation of household goods carriers.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals the RSA chapter that regulates carriers of household goods

BillTitle: repealing RSA 323 regarding lightning rod dealers and salesmen.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals RSA 323, relative to lightning rod dealers and salesmen.

BillTitle: relative to the licensure and regulation of music therapists.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes the music therapy governing board in the office of allied health professionals for the licensure and regulation of practitioners of music therapy.

BillTitle: increasing exemptions under the interest and dividends tax and decreasing the total amount of research and development credits against business taxes.
BillAnalysis: This bill increases exemption amounts under the interest and dividends tax and decreases the annual total aggregate amount of the research and development tax credit against business taxes.

BillTitle: revising certain benefit provisions in the city of Manchester employees contributory retirement system.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes new benefit provisions for the employees' contributory retirement system of the City of Manchester originally established in 1973, 218 for participants who commence service on or after January 1, 2021.  This bill increases the member contribution for participants until the plan reaches a 100 percent funded ratio and increases the normal retirement age.  This bill will also mitigate the cost to the Manchester employees' contributory retirement system for early retirement and adjust the final average earning calculation.

BillTitle: relative to drug courts and alternative drug offender grant programs.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows a drug court to order an offender to participate in social work or mental health consultations as a condition of sentence completion.

BillTitle: relative to the elimination of useful thermal energy from renewable energy classes.
BillAnalysis: This bill removes the inclusion of technologies producing useful thermal energy from the minimum  electric renewable portfolio standards.

BillTitle: relative to school building aid grants.
permitting school districts to contract with independent schools and private schools.
BillAnalysis: This bill permits a school district to contract with an independent school or private school in this or another state.

BillTitle: relative to public notice of and access to meetings under the right to know law.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes requirements for remote access to public meetings under RSA 91-A.

BillTitle: repealing RSA 320 regarding hawkers and peddlers.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals RSA 320, relative to the regulation of hawkers and peddlers.

BillTitle: repealing RSA 321 regarding itinerant vendors.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals RSA 321, relative to itinerant vendors.

BillTitle: repealing RSA 332-J regarding athlete agents.
BillAnalysis: This bill repeals RSA 332-J, relative to athlete agents.

BillTitle: establishing medical freedom in immunizations.
BillAnalysis: This bill establishes the policy for medical freedom in immunizations for communicable diseases.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: making the state vaccine registry an opt-in program.
BillAnalysis: This bill makes the state immunization registry an opt-in program rather than an opt-out program.
Next/Last Comm:: HouseHealth, Human Services and Elderly Affairs

BillTitle: authorizing New Hampshire municipalities to issue decals for motor vehicle plates to municipal officers.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds New Hampshire municipalities to the list of organizations approved to issue decals for multi-use plates, provided that such decals are issued solely to municipal officers upon showing of proof of office.

BillTitle: relative to political party access to a list of absentee ballot requests.
BillAnalysis: This bill authorizes political parties to request and subscribe to the absentee ballot request list from the secretary of state.

BillTitle: relative to tinted windows on motor vehicles.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows for after market tinting of side windows.

BillTitle: relative to the calculation of net energy metering payments or credits.
BillAnalysis: This bill changes the methods of calculating and paying for the energy net metered by a customer-generator to an electric distribution utility each billing period.

BillTitle: relative to the repeal of laws on produce safety.
BillAnalysis: This bill extends the date for the repeal of the laws on produce safety.

BillTitle: relative to termination of tenancy at the expiration of the tenancy or lease term.
BillAnalysis: This bill adds the expiration of the term of the lease or tenancy if over 6 months as grounds for an eviction.

BillTitle: relative to the calculation of child support in cases with equal or approximately equal parenting time.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides a formula for the calculation of child support in cases with equal or approximately equal parenting time.

BillTitle: defining "wake boat."
BillAnalysis: This bill defines "wake boat."

BillTitle: a resolution
a resolution
a resolution
a resolution
a resolution
memorializing Richard W. Hinch.
calling for the Netflix show "Cuties" to be taken off the air.
BillAnalysis: This resolution calls for the Netflix show "Cuties" to be taken off the air and urges the United States Department of Justice to investigate whether the show violates federal law regarding sexual exploitation of children.

BillTitle: allowing the preprocessing of absentee ballots for certain 2021 elections and allowing for the postponement of annual town meetings in calendar year 2021 where concerns exist during the COVID-19 health emergency.
BillAnalysis: This bill temporarily allows for the preprocessing of absentee ballots at elections held through July 1, 2021.  The bill also allows for the postponement of annual town meetings in calendar year 2021 where concerns exist during the COVID-19 health emergency.

BillTitle: relative to the direct shipping of liquor.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows the liquor commission to register trade names with the secretary of state to operate as a direct shipper of liquor and wine.

BillTitle: relative to ratification of amendments to the state building code.
BillAnalysis: This bill ratifies certain amendments to the state building code and the state fire code.

BillTitle: amending the alimony statute due to changes in federal tax law.
BillAnalysis: This bill revises the formula for term alimony because of recent changes in federal income tax law.  The bill recognizes that alimony is no longer either deductible by the payor or taxable to the payee.

BillTitle: relative to brew pubs allowing customers to bring dogs to outdoor areas.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows municipalities to adopt ordinances to allow dogs in outdoor areas of brew pubs.

BillTitle: permitting tastings by liquor manufacturers at farmers markets.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows liquor manufacturers to offer samples at farmers markets.

BillTitle: relative to the degree granting authority of Signum university.
BillAnalysis: This bill authorizes Signum University to grant degrees in New Hampshire.

BillTitle: relative to one year certificates of eligibility to teach.
BillAnalysis: This bill exempts individuals applying to teach a course in a CTE specialty area from the bachelor's degree requirement for a one-year certificate of eligibility to teach.

BillTitle: relative to the Pease development authority board of directors.
BillAnalysis: This bill provides that the change to the quorum for the Pease development authority board of directors made pursuant to HB 243 (2019, 256) shall not take effect on April 30, 2021.  The quorum required under current law shall remain unchanged.

BillTitle: relative to the sale of Lucky 7 tickets.
BillAnalysis: This bill allows the play of electric Lucky 7 games and sets a limit for the Lucky 7 deal size the commission may authorize.

BillTitle: changing the requirement that a member of the sponsoring charitable organization be present during certain games of chance.
BillAnalysis: This bill requires a member of the sponsoring charitable organization to be present during games of chance at least once during the contract period.

BillTitle: relative to the Brewster Academy charter.
BillAnalysis: This bill amends the charter of the Brewster Academy by increasing the membership on the Brewster Academy board of trustees.  The bill also allows Brewster Academy to amend its charter in accordance with the provisions of RSA 292:7 governing the powers of voluntary corporations.

BillTitle: relative to charity gaming licenses.
BillAnalysis: This bill changes the term of a charity gaming license from 12 months from issue to annually expiring on December 31.

BillTitle: relative to roads within the Woodsville Fire District.
BillAnalysis: This bill:

BillTitle: relative to the sale of lucky 7 tickets.
BillAnalysis: This bill:

BillTitle: naming a courtroom in the second circuit courthouse in Plymouth in honor of Judge Edwin W. Kelly.
BillAnalysis: This bill renames a courtroom in the second circuit courthouse in Plymouth in honor of Judge Edwin W. Kelly.

BillTitle: RESOLVED, that the Rules of the 2019-2020 Session be adopted as the Rules of the 2021-2022 Session, with the changes which have been provided here today.
RESOLVED, that the Secretary of State be requested to furnish the Senate with the official return of votes from the various Senatorial Districts.

RESOLVED, that the return of votes from the several Senatorial Districts be referred to a Select Committee of three with instructions to examine and count the same and report to the Senate where any vacancies or contest exists and if so, in what Senatorial District.

RESOLVED, that the biennium salary of the members of the Senate be paid in one undivided sum as early as practical after adoption of this resolution, and be it further RESOLVED, that the mileage of members of the Senate be paid every two weeks during the session.
RESOLVED, that the Senate meet in Joint Convention with the House of Representatives for the purpose of electing the Secretary of State and the State Treasurer.

RESOLVED, in accordance with Article 42, Part 2, of the New Hampshire Constitution that the Honorable William M. Gardner, Secretary of State be requested to lay before the Senate the return votes for Governor and Executive Council.
RESOLVED, that the vote for Governor and Executive Council be referred to a Select Committee consisting of two with instruction to examine and count the same and report to the Senate.
